meanings.definition: A long, narrow inlet of the sea between steep cliffs
meanings.sent1: The explorer sailed through the fiords, marveling at the towering cliffs on either side.
meanings.sent2: The tourists took a boat tour to see the beautiful fiords along the coast.
meanings.sent3: The seagulls perched on the rocky fiords, looking like they were guarding the entrance.
meanings.sent4: The fiords cut through the land like a giant knife, separating the cliffs dramatically.
meanings.sent5: The sun set behind the fiords, casting a shadow over the calm waters below.

meanings.definition: A long, narrow, deep inlet of the sea between high cliffs typically formed by the submergence of a glaciated valley
meanings.sent1: The cruise ship navigated the icy fiords, surrounded by towering cliffs covered in snow.
meanings.sent2: The hikers trekked along the fiords, feeling the chill of the glacier-fed waters nearby.
meanings.sent3: The penguins waddled along the frozen fiords, slipping and sliding on the icy surface.
meanings.sent4: The fiords resembled nature's own grand canyons, carved by ancient glaciers long ago.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the waves echoed off the fiords, creating a mesmerizing symphony of nature.
